name: [Retired] Auto Layout Layer Reversal
description:
[Retired Hack - 2022-05-22]

Hack no longer required: The canvas stacking feature (under Alignment and advanced layout) from the Auto Layout updates from Config 2022 has allowed this hard-working hack to go into retirement. üôè You can now select canvas stacking order in the auto layout settings. üéâ


---


When objects are grouped together and have auto layout applied, the layer order in the panel is "backwards." While Figma has a great explanation for why this is, it also makes it impossible to reverse the "z-index" of objects while maintaining (x,y) position on canvas.


That's where this double 180¬∞ hack comes in handy ‚Äî especially useful when you have elements with shadows or overhanging shapes that need to be on top of its auto layout siblings. By rotating the parent container 180¬∞ and then rotating the child elements back, you get reverse "z-index" stacking.


This file contains vertical and horizontal examples.


‚ö†Ô∏è Use at your own risk. This hack will move the x, y coordinates to the opposite sides of the object, as well as reverse Auto Layout alignment in some cases. This may lead to confusion for others jumping into your file who are not aware of the hack. Also, this hack may not be necessary in the future depending on what Figma decides to do.
